title: CaptureException must be used correctly throughout the code base

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

labels.name: severity-important
labels.description: major effect on the usability of a package, without rendering it completely unusable to everyone

body:
I saw this in the context of re-rendering the handbook, and checking the diff between the previous and current outputs of datalad commands.
When a ``datalad update`` fails, current ``master`` does not display any hint whatsoever on why. ``maint`` on the other hand tells me so much that it is hard to find the meaningful part of the message:

```sh
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:bf-5644
❱ git co master
Switched to branch 'master'
Your branch is ahead of 'gh-adswa/master' by 3 commits.
  (use "git push" to publish your local commits)
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:master
❱ datalad update -s juselessadina        
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for Dataset(/home/adina/repos/datalad) 
[ERROR  ] Fetch failed:  [update(/home/adina/repos/datalad)] 
update(error): . (dataset) [Fetch failed: ]
```
```sh
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:master
❱ git co maint                                                                                                 1 !
Switched to branch 'maint'
Your branch is up to date with 'upstream/maint'.
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:maint
❱ datalad update -s juselessadina
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for Dataset(/home/adina/repos/datalad) 
[ERROR  ] Fetch failed: CommandError: 'git -c diff.ignoreSubmodules=none fetch --verbose --progress --no-recurse-submodules --prune juselessadina' failed with exitcode 128 under /home/adina/repos/datalad [err: 'fatal: '/home/adina/scratch/datala22d' does not appear to be a git repository
CommandError: 'ssh -o ControlPath=/home/adina/.cache/datalad/sockets/3b4eaa1d -o SendEnv=GIT_PROTOCOL adina@juseless.inm7.de 'export "PATH=/usr/bin:$PATH"; git-upload-pack '"'"'/home/adina/scratch/datala22d'"'"''' failed with exitcode 128
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.'] [cmd.py:run:408] [update(/home/adina/repos/datalad)] 
update(error): . (dataset) [Fetch failed: CommandError: 'git -c diff.ignoreSubmodules=none fetch --verbose --progress --no-recurse-submodules --prune juselessadina' failed with exitcode 128 under /home/adina/repos/datalad [err: 'fatal: '/home/adina/scratch/datala22d' does not appear to be a git repository
CommandError: 'ssh -o ControlPath=/home/adina/.cache/datalad/sockets/3b4eaa1d -o SendEnv=GIT_PROTOCOL adina@juseless.inm7.de 'export "PATH=/usr/bin:$PATH"; git-upload-pack '"'"'/home/adina/scratch/datala22d'"'"''' failed with exitcode 128
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.'] [cmd.py:run:408]]
```

The information also is not in the JSON records (there seems to be no message for "fetch failed"):

```sh
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:maint
❱ git co master                                                                                                1 !
Switched to branch 'master'
Your branch is ahead of 'gh-adswa/master' by 75 commits.
  (use "git push" to publish your local commits)
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:master
❱ datalad -f json_pp update -s juselessadina 
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for Dataset(/home/adina/repos/datalad) 
[ERROR  ] Fetch failed:  [update(/home/adina/repos/datalad)] 
{
  "action": "update",
  "message": [
    "Fetch failed: %s",
    ""
  ],
  "path": "/home/adina/repos/datalad",
  "refds": "/home/adina/repos/datalad",
  "status": "error",
  "type": "dataset"
}
```

```sh
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:master
❱ git co maint                                                                                                 1 !
Switched to branch 'maint'
Your branch is up to date with 'upstream/maint'.
(handbook2) adina@muninn in ~/repos/datalad on git:maint
❱ datalad -f json_pp update -s juselessadina 
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for Dataset(/home/adina/repos/datalad) 
[ERROR  ] Fetch failed: CommandError: 'git -c diff.ignoreSubmodules=none fetch --verbose --progress --no-recurse-submodules --prune juselessadina' failed with exitcode 128 under /home/adina/repos/datalad [err: 'fatal: '/home/adina/scratch/datala22d' does not appear to be a git repository
CommandError: 'ssh -o ControlPath=/home/adina/.cache/datalad/sockets/3b4eaa1d -o SendEnv=GIT_PROTOCOL adina@juseless.inm7.de 'export "PATH=/usr/bin:$PATH"; git-upload-pack '"'"'/home/adina/scratch/datala22d'"'"''' failed with exitcode 128
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.'] [cmd.py:run:408] [update(/home/adina/repos/datalad)] 
{
  "action": "update",
  "path": "/home/adina/repos/datalad",
  "refds": "/home/adina/repos/datalad",
  "status": "error",
  "type": "dataset"
}
```

I guess this is related to #5691? The output that ``maint`` provides is unhelpful because its hard to parse it - especially with the line breaks that the error message from Git adds to it. But the output that ``master`` provides is unhelpful, because now I have to idea at all what might be going on.
